intro: Centaurea micevskii, commonly known as the Micevsky's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and spiny, bristly leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
